comments:

Unable to create view: org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl

Based on the call stack, this likely belongs to either Visual Editor project (org.eclipse.jem) or WTP project (org.eclipse.wst.common).

Visual Editor: http://www.eclipse.org/vep/WebContent/main.php
WTP project: http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/development/arch_and_design/ArchitectureOverviewInitial.html

I isn't JEM as far as I can tell. The problem is that an EMFContext (EMFWorkbenchContextBase) was created and the URI converter was changed from the default WorkbenchURIConverter that EMFWorkbenchContextBase.createURIConverter returns and EMFWorkbenchContextBase.initializeResourceSet sets into the the ProjectResourceSetImpl, and was set with a standard URIConverter instead. JEM doesn't do that. Some other extension of the EMF natures would of done it.
Reassigning to wst.common as that looks to be the WTP component making use of JEM.
*** Bug 149896 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 149955 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Michael,

Can you take a look?  This sounds very similar to some of the startup issues you resolved last month....   Usually due to downstream plugins delaring early startup, and activating plugins out of order.

Does this happen for any 3.1 workspace? Or was there a specific workspace?

Does it happen every time or just the first time you load the 3.1 workspace?

What is your configuration (Eclipse + WTP + ? what other components?)? 

What build were you running on? (3.2 proper or an RC build or a Milestone build)? 

Do you get this problem without the Maven IDE extensions (org.maven.ide.eclipse.container.*) loaded?

Are you talking about the Package Explorer in the Java Perspective or the Project Explorer in the J2EE Perspective, or both?

Does the Resource Navigator (in the Resource perspective) show your files?

Did you use this workspace with Eclipse 3.1 + WTP 1.0 before?
Removing the milestone target until we can determine the cause of the problem and whether we can safely release a fix at this time.
With no feedback from the originator, and no reproducible test case, I am forced to close this defect as INVALID.

I received the following feedback from Jose: 


I had no chance to reopen the bug ...

Eclipse configuration I have has "all taks in background" maybe this is the cause.

Try the following steps:
1) open a Web Project with Eclipse, open some Java files, show them in the 
package explorer
2) close Eclipse
3) reopen the workspace
you'll get:
